body.name: Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55-53E5 Gaming Laptop | Intel Core i5-10300H | NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Laptop GPU | 15.6" FHD 144Hz IPS Display | 8GB DDR4 | 256GB NVMe SSD | Intel Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard

Best Sellers Rank: #107 in Computers & Accessories (See Top 100 in Computers & Accessories)   #5 in Traditional Laptop Computers

body.full_description: Acer gaming laptops deliver advanced performance for all gamers. The Nitro lineup of gaming PCs and accessories are ideal for casual gamers who are ready for something better. The Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55 is equipped with a beautiful 15.6 inch FHD display to help you visualize the win. The latest NVIDIA GeForce RTX 30 series GPU supports 2nd Gen Ray Tracing Cores, 3rd Gen Tensor Cores, DLSS, Resizable BAR, Microsoft DirectX 12 Ultimate, and so much more. With Killer Ethernet and Wi-Fi 6, get quicker matchmaking and never worry about disconnecting during a game. The Acer Nitro 5 with Intel Core i5 processing power enables impressive performance whether you're challenging your buddies to battle or focusing on a new hobby. This Acer Nitro laptop is configured with 8GB RAM memory and 256GB solid-state drive storage space, and the ability to upgrade as needed. Use the HDMI 2.0 port for a monitor, use power-off USB charging, and plug in your favorite accessories with the array of USB Type-A and USB Type-C ports. (NH.QB0AA.001).
body.availability_status: In Stock.                       Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
body.product_category: Electronics › Computers & Accessories › Computers & Tablets › Laptops › Traditional Laptops
body.small_description:
About this item
 
Dominate the Game: With the 10th Gen Intel Core i5-10300H processor, your Nitro 5 is packed with incredible power for all your games RTX, It's On: The latest NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 (4GB dedicated GDDR6 VRAM) is powered by award-winning architecture with new Ray Tracing Cores, Tensor Cores, and streaming multiprocessors support DirectX 12 Ultimate for the ultimate gaming performance Visual Intensity: Explore game worlds in Full HD detail on the 15.6" widescreen LED-backlit IPS display with 1920 x 1080 resolution, 144Hz refresh rate and 80% screen-to-body, 16:9 aspect ratio Internal Specifications: 8GB DDR4 2933MHz Memory (2 DDR4 Slots Total, Maximum 32GB); 256GB NVMe SSD (2 x PCIe M.2 Slots, 1 x 2.5" Hard Drive Bay Available) Prioritize Your Gameplay: Killer Ethernet E2600 and Intel Wi-Fi 6 AX201 gives you an edge online by taking control of your network and prioritizing your gameplay Stay Cool Under Pressure: When heavy use requires an added boost, Acer CoolBoost technology increases fan speed by 10% and CPU, GPU cooling by 9% compared to auto mode, overall increasing thermal performance by 25% for better gaming comfort Take Control of Your Gaming Laptop: The NitroSense UI can be called up with the dedicated keyboard button so you can instantly visualize your PC's component temperature, fan speed, loading performance, power plan, and more 
 With Alexa Show Mode, you can use your PC as a full-screen interactive experience that features rich visuals and lets you talk to Alexa from across the room.Ports For All Your Accessories: USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C, 2 USB 3.2 Gen 1, USB 3.2 Gen 2 (Power-off Charging), HDMI 2.0 with HDCP support, Headphone, Speaker, Line-out Jack, Ethernet (RJ-45), DC-in for AC adapterThe Right Fit: 14.31" W x 10.04" D x 0.94" H; 5.07 lbs; One-Year International Travelers Limited Warranty (ITW); Up to 11 hours of Battery LifeShow more

api_list.name: Get Amazon Product Details

product.name: Acer Nitro 5 AN515-55-53E5 Gaming Laptop | Intel Core i5-10300H | NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Laptop GPU | 15.6" FHD 144Hz IPS Display | 8GB DDR4 | 256GB NVMe SSD | Intel Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit Keyboard

top_positive_review.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021
top_positive_review.title: Runs Sims 4 beautifully!
top_positive_review.review: I’m in love with this laptop. I was looking for a review about running the sims 4 with a lot of packs but now that I have it, i’ll say it. This laptop runs the Sims 4 on Ultra graphics with all of the packs and tons of CC and mods BEAUTIFULLY.  It doesn’t miss a single beat. Loads in less than 30 seconds, and that’s only with 8 gb of RAM. The screen quality is so nice too, it looks like it has an overlay almost. It starts up quickly, loads web pages super fast. I can see myself thoroughly enjoying watching movies on this laptop even. I don’t know how it compares to other gaming or high end laptops, but if you’re like me and you have a piece of crap laptop and you’re used to it taking almost an hour to load the Sims on medium graphics, you will be BLOWN AWAY. The laptop is super light and thin. The keyboard has a nice feel to it, i like the back light but i wish you could change the color. I played with it for 6 hours straight and the fans are super quiet, and it doesn’t heat up that much at all. It does slow down a little without being hooked up, but i don’t plan on using it portably so I can’t speak to that. This was worth every penny, and I’m really grateful for Acer packing so much power at a good price. I don’t see how it gets any better than this for little ol’ me

top_critical_review.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2021
top_critical_review.title: Arrived dead.  Ordered a replacement, it came dead.
top_critical_review.review: The unit arrived dead.  Plugged in the AC adapter firmly, checked cords, (we had a second AC adapter of the same specs).  Power lights never lit up and the unit would not turn on.I ordered a second one. It just arrived and it game dead.  I have to send this one back now too.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021
reviews.title: Best laptop for the value on the market right now.
reviews.review: I purchased the i5-10300H/RTX3050 version of this laptop.I was looking for a laptop with specific specs for under $1,000 and this checked all the boxes.I wanted a 15inch laptop with an amazing looking screen with and IPS panel running at 144Hz and a decent GPU that could utilize it.I ended up getting this laptop and adding a 500GB SSD additional storage and 8gb of Crucial RAM 8GB DDR4 3200 MHz to bump this up to 16GB total.  This ended up making the laptop much cheaper then buying one with that much ram and size of SSD in it on its own.The way the heat is distributed on this laptop (near the back by the screen) keeps my wrists from burning up like I have had with prior laptops.This thing has been able to run every game I play with at least 60fps on ultra settings.New world ultra settings - around 60-80fpsFF14 ultra settings - around 100 fps tbd the areaCall of duty medium settings - around 120 (did this on purpose to take advantage of the higher refresh rate)Smite Ultra settings - 80+ fpsThis laptop is hands down the best bang for your buck.  If you are really looking for a higher end laptop then your going to be spending between the $1500-2000 mark.  If you are trying to keep it under $1000 this was the best performance I was able to find for the price.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2021
reviews.title: Arrived dead.  Ordered a replacement, it came dead.
reviews.review: The unit arrived dead.  Plugged in the AC adapter firmly, checked cords, (we had a second AC adapter of the same specs).  Power lights never lit up and the unit would not turn on.I ordered a second one. It just arrived and it game dead.  I have to send this one back now too.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021
reviews.title: Didn't turn on. Delivered in a loose oversized box.
reviews.review: Laptop did not turn on or recognize power source when plugged in. Looks like a nice expensive paperweight.  The laptop was received in a large cardboard Box commaxe come up about twice the size of the product Box. Possibly damaged during delivery because there was plenty of space to bounce around. After looking at reviews it seems that this power issue is a common issue for this laptop.Decided to purchase this laptop after my original pick was lost during delivery for almost a week and Amazon wanted me to pay an extra $100 after the price went up. Customer service was not accommodating in the least.  The whole ordeal has been a major frustration and waste of time. Will not be purchasing any big ticket items or electronics from Amazon again.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2021
reviews.title: leer las instrucciones..
reviews.review: que bruto pongale 0... recibi la laptop hace un par de dias y me asuste mucho, porque no encendia, ni cargaba ni encendia ninguna luz.. la deje toda la noche conectada pensando que podia haber venido descargada de bateria, pero nada.. al dia siguiente ya estaba a punto de contactar a soporte para enviarla a garantia, y me puse a leer el manual. cuya instruccion decia, al conectar el cargador asegurese de empujarlo hasta escuchar un click...ahi estaba el fallo.  despues de conectarlo correctamente, encendio de una y hasta ahora vade maravillas..

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
reviews.title: Didn't charge or start
reviews.review: I anticipate your questions - was the AC adapter plugged in correctly, was the outlet working? I checked both several times, all fine, just no response from the battery charge light, no lights whatsoever, no charge, no start.This is directly after unboxing, btw, so it was incredibly disappointing to be shipped a 750 dollar paperweight. I am in the process of getting my refund, and will never purchase an ACER again.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
reviews.title: Best bang for your Buck
reviews.review: Good laptop, this i5 10300 H and RTX 3050 is a great combination add a extra stick of ram make sure it’s @2933 and you should be okay. I would suggest just buying a duel channel kit of Corsair vengeance @ 2933 just to make sure the ram dimms work together probably. You can always add more storage later as Acer acutely advertises right on the laptop itself you can basically open it and add more at any time you see fit. For games like WoW open world 89-144 fps out questing. PvP epic or random around a average in the 90s fps with medium/high settings can handle being upscaled in game to 1440p with a small performance hit. But is great at 1080p seeing it’s a smaller screen resolution @ 1080p looks amazing. color is a tad lack luster but not a dealbreaker by any means at this price point does well with fallout series and other games as well. I honestly did not expect this to perform as well as it does. Honestly I think it’s handles games just as well as a gtx 1070 or in at or right under 1660ti desktop version. The 4GB v ram is not going to be able to handle ultra setting in most newer games. but with the smaller screen turning down certain settings are going to get you great performance With almost no visual quality loss. I would take higher refresh rate over higher resolution any day certain games you may not be able to achieve the 144hz but anything over 60 is going to stay buttery smooth. You will have one extra nvme ssd slot under the one in use I do believe that can handle up to a 2TB drive and a 2.5 sata drive slot as well. I Iiked it so much my girlfriend wanted a laptop and I couldn’t justify buying anything less even though she only plays sims 4. I can’t bring myself to buy anything in the 600 to 700$ range that only runs on integrated graphics it’s just not worth the money.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2021
reviews.title: DOESNT CHARGE UPON OPENING
reviews.review: When I opened the laptop and plugged it in there was absolutely no activity, charging light did not turn on and laptop had no precharge. After a panicky hour of trying to figure out what's wrong with my brand new very expensive laptop, and realizing how many one star reviews were here for this exact issue, I cannot stress this enough, SHOVE THE CHARGER IN. It is VERY SNUG and you really REALLY have to push it hard. There is a very significant click of the charger going in, and as soon as it did everything was fine. Haven't used it yet, but wanted to update, as I now understand what all the one star reviews about this laptop being DOA are really about. Happy gaming!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021
reviews.title: DOA-DON’T DO IT, ITS RUSSIAN ROULETTE
reviews.review: Like a moth to a flame I was mesmerized by the value and great review ratings and I ignored the fact that there are at least SIX REVIEWS IN THE LAST TWO WEEKS saying their machine (like mine) wouldn’t even turn on!! Most stores would recognize this as a problem but Amazon shamefully just keeps selling this junk.  This was in my house 3 hours before I got my money back along with arrangements for them to pick up the craptop at my door to return it.  I will find another (non Acer) laptop, and I will buy it from somewhere other than Amazon.  There has to be a price to pay for knowingly selling defective products.EDIT:  Just want to address the “you have to press the charger plug in extra hard” comments from other reviews. Imagine you buy a brand new car and the dealer tells you that you need to use extra force when you close your door otherwise it will stay open and the car won’t run.  Are you going to be ok with that? Not me. And even if that’s the issue,  why didn’t support know it when I talked to them?  Also why is the battery at zero % therefore requiring the charger to power up? My replacement MSI worked perfectly right out of the box.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021
reviews.title: Great laptop for gaming and 3d work cons very little vr support
reviews.review: I love this laptop, I push my laptop pretty hard, I use Blender, Daz3d and a few other software's for 3d modeling and rendering. this laptop can handle it pretty well. with blender cycles I could do optiX gpu rendering. in Daz Studio I was able to get a decent render using Nivdia iray with pretty good real time feed back. for games I was able to play Planetside 2 at a pretty good resolution at a good frame rate probably not like 120 fps on ulta high but it didnt dip below 30. with two m.2 drives on the bottom and a full ssd slot as well (cable is included so if you buy second hand watch out) I was able to get good storage. ram is upgradeable to 32 gbs which in the end is a pretty strong work horse. upgrading it was a bit scary as its not under the keyboard you have to take the bottom off and use a thin of plastic guitar pick or ifixit to open it up. go onto YouTube to watch a break down, its not to hard to upgrade. batter life is not great but you could tailor it by having it turn off lights and lower screen brightness. built in Bluetooth and full ethernet port 2 usb 3 ports and one usb c. which brings me to my con and that is very little vr support. I played vr games on a even older graphic card than this, and yet this RTX 3050 has no display port or a fast enough usb c to support an adapter. I cant say about the quest but I have a rift s and it will not work on this laptop.  if you are looking for a mid workstation laptop this might fill the bill, if you are looking to get this for an artist going into school this one would be a good deal with the dedicated gpu this will extend the life of this computer to be able to handle most 3d and 2d applications.Pros:great power for the costhas some room for upgradesok for 3d workok for gamingCons:limited VR Supportbattery life is kind of short
